contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Hatnote|This article is about the district in Tokushima Prefecture, Japan. There is another district with the same [[Japanese language|Japanese]] name (海部郡) in [[Aichi Prefecture]], see [[Ama District, Aichi]].}} [[File:Tokushima-kaifu-district.svg|220px|thumb|right|Location in Tokushima Prefecture<br />[[Media:Tokushima-kaifu-district.svg|See SVG File]]]] {{Nihongo|'''Kaifu'''|海部郡|Kaifu-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 26,399 and a [[population density|density]] of 50.28 persons per km². The total area is 525.00 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Mugi, Tokushima|Mugi]] *[[Kaiyō, Tokushima|Kaiyō]] *[[Minami, Tokushima|Minami]] ==Municipal timeline== *March 31, 2006: The towns of [[Kainan, Tokushima|Kainan]], [[Kaifu, Tokushima|Kaifu]] and [[Shishikui, Tokushima|Shishikui]] merged to form the new town of [[Kaiyō, Tokushima|Kaiyō]]. On the same date, the towns of [[Hiwasa, Tokushima|Hiwasa]] and [[Yuki, Tokushima|Yuki]] merged to form the new town of [[Minami, Tokushima|Minami]]. {{Tokushima}} {{coord|33.691|N|134.375|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
